reviews.text: Nice station, clean and ample parking there's just one thing missing a shop with a coffee machine
Seems like under Abellio the famous Double arrows of BR are making a welcoming return to the railways or at least on the stations signs at stations it operates.

The rebuilding and refurbishment of this station has finally made the area much more viable for traveling by train. It has double the platforms, pretty much more than double the daily services stopping, lifts and braille plated signage to make this station very accessible and a huge car park with a small taxi rank out the front.

The station has toilets, however they can only be used when station staff are present to unlock it for you. It's a good looking station with the only downside being that it's a half hour walk away from the town centre. It might as well be named Bromsgrove Parkway.

The lady working in the ticket office today at 1015 is am angel. I thought I'd forgotten my phone so couldn't pick my ticket to London up. She grabbed her phone and let me log in to my email account and retrieve the reference number.
The place is much better than the old station, but where is the shop that is a big let down, get on with it
